item.title: Biography of Cesar Chavez
item.description: Cesar Chavez, in full Cesar Estrada Chavez, (born March 31, 1927, Yuma, Arizona, U.S.â€”died April 23, 1993, San Luis, Arizona), organizer of migrant American farmworkers and a cofounder with Dolores Huerta of the National Farm Workers Association (NFWA) in 1962. Chavez, who was a farm labourer himself, grew up in a migrant farm-labour family of Mexican American descent. He lived in a succession of migrant camps and attended school sporadically.
